brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to examine the effects of the Incredible Years Baby Programme (IY baby) compared to Usual Care (UC) for parents with infants aged 0-12 months.

detailed_description.textblock: A randomised controlled effectiveness trial of the Incredible Years Baby Programme (IY baby)in Denmark. 200 families will be randomised to IY Baby (intervention) og UC (control). Families recruited to the study have infants aged 0-12 months. In one municipality first time mothers are recruited. In the other municipalities health nurses or social workers only recruit families where they are worried about the insecurity in the parenting role.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.description: The KPCS measures perceived parenting self-efficacy (PPSE) in parents of children aged 0-12 months. High PPSE has been shown to act as a buffer against factors that can compromise a child's development, such as parental depression, anxiety, stress and relationship difficulties, and is associated with actual parenting competence and positive child outcomes The KPCS is a short self-report instrument. It was developed in Australia primarily for health professionals experienced in working with parentcraft and psychosocial issues of early parenthood, including Maternal, Child and Family Health Nurses, and allied health and medical professionals.

primary_outcome.measure: Bayley Scales of Infant and Toddler Development- Third Edition (Bayley-III)
primary_outcome.description: Bayley-III measures cognitive, language, motor, social-emotional, and adaptive development of children between the ages of 1 month and 42 months. It consists of a series of developmental play tasks and takes between 45 - 60 minutes to administer.

arm_group.description: In the Incredible Years Parents and Babies Program, parents learn how to help their babies feel loved, safe, and secure. They learn how to encourage their babies' physical and language development. The parenting group format fosters peer support networks and shared learning. Trained Incredible Years facilitators use video clips of real-life situational vignettes to support the training and stimulate parenting group discussions and practice exercises with their babies. The program is group based with 6-8 mothers and partners attending 8-10 2 hour sessions with their babies.
Usual care consists of different kinds of interventions aimed at parents with infants ages 0-12 months including extra health nurse visits, Marte Meo and family therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parents where the municipality is worried about insecurity in the parenting role/first time parents
- child aged 0-4 months
- able to understand Danish at a basic level
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious physical disability
- serious mental disability
- for first time mothers the child must not be placed in out of home care
